item.title: A New Leak Is Fueling Speculation That The Pokémon Animal Crossing Game Turns Your Childhood Into A Graveyard
item.content:encoded:
Ever since The Pokémon Company announced Pokémon Pokopia, the Animal Crossing-style life sim game has seemed a little off. Your character is helping rebuild a small town so Pokémon can live there, but the space is filled with desecrated buildings, and humans are nowhere to be found. Fans have been speculating that the cozy game might not be so cozy after all, and that it may take place in a post-apocalyptic version of the Kanto region from the original Pokémon games. Now, a leak may have confirmed this.

A leaked map outlines the status of Kanto in Pokopia, with descriptions for each “area,” named after the cities and towns that once stood there. A translation posted by Pokémon leak account Centro Leaks describes these desolate areas, and each of them sounds like they’ve succumbed to the elements. Fuschia city, which fans have speculated might be the first area shown in most of Pokopia‘s trailers, is said to be “dried up and unfertilized fieldland.” Vermillion City, which was once occupied by Lt. Surge’s electric gym and a harbor city for ships to arrive and depart from, is roughly translated as a “constant raining electrical harbor.” 

The rest of the descriptions sure do make it sound like humanity has been gone for a long time. Saffron City’s metropolitan area is “covered with plants,” Pewter City has been “abandoned” and is covered in rocks, and Lavender Town’s Pokémon Tower is now “rotten” but believed to reach heaven. 

Pokópia is post-apocalyptic Kanto CONFIRMED!

➡️ Base game areas:
Area 1 – Fuscha Area – Dried up and unfertilized fieldland
Area 2 – Vermillion Area – Constant raining electrical harbor
Area 3 – Pewter Area – An abandoned mine covered by rocks
Area 4 – Saffron Area – Bunch of… https://t.co/JPySgYGnBW

— Centro LEAKS (@CentroLeaks) December 3, 2025

Just how much Pokopia will reckon with this remains to be seen, but the environment isn’t the only indicator that something terrible happened in Kanto in this game. The game includes new forms for Pikachu, Snorlax, and Smeargle that have elements to their character design that imply a lot of time has passed since they last interacted with humans. I’m really curious to see how deep this game goes into its tragic “what if” storyline when it comes to Switch 2 on March 5.

item.title: ASUS Goes Full Clearance on Its Graphics Cards as the GeForce RTX 5070 Drops to a New Record Low
item.content:encoded:
Those looking to game better or push some creative boundaries this holiday season; we’ve got good news. The top-rated ASUS GeForce RTX 5070 just hit its lowest price ever, and it’s even better than what it dipped to during Black Friday!

This graphics card sits at $710, but you can currently grab it for just $570 at Amazon, after the retailer took 20% off its price. The deal is open to all shoppers, and there are no delivery charges to worry about. Even better, this isn’t one of those complicated-to-score discounts. You don’t need to enter any complicated coupon codes or follow long checkout steps to grab the discount. Just throw it in your cart, and the offer applies automatically. The only thing to note is that the retailer has marked the deal as a fast-selling one. That means the stock, or the drop itself, is only going to be around for a short time, and it won’t be long before we see them wrap up. It’s better to act now if you don’t want to run into last-minute disappointments later on.

See at Amazon

Great Visuals, Even Better Performance

RTX is the most advanced platform for full ray tracing and neural rendering tech that completely upgrades the way you work and play. The graphics card is powered by the NVIDIA Blackwell architecture and DLSS 4, featuring fifth-gen tensor cores for better AI performance, latest streaming multiprocessors that are optimized for neutral shader, and fourth-gen ray tracing cores specifically built for mega geometry. DLSS4 uses AI to boost FPS, reduce latency, and make the overall image quality top-notch, while the Blackwell architecture makes cinematic quality visuals at unbelievable speeds possible.

The 2.5 slot design of the card offers better build compatibility while maintaining cooling performance, regardless of how intense things get. Cooling mechanism includes a premium phase-change GPU thermal pad that softens under heat to fill the gaps between the GPU and thermal module effectively, resulting in superior thermal conductivity and better heat dissipation throughout your sessions. The axial-tech fans come with longer blades, alongside a barrier ring to increase the downward air pressure, while the 0db tech stops the fans automatically when the temperature of the GPU goes 50 degrees. The latter makes it easy to focus on light tasks without any distracting sound, and puts the fans back to work at 55 degrees when things start to heat up. You can also switch between Quiet and Performance BIOS profiles manually; the former offers a calmer operation, while the latter maximizes performance for resource-intensive tasks.

The card comes with a GPU guard that applies adhesive to secure all four corners of the GPU to keep it firmly in place. Dual-ball bearings are designed to last up to twice as long as sleeve bearings, while the protective backplate does a good job of keeping the components safe from external damage. What’s more, the Tuning tool makes overclocking, cooling control, and monitoring the performance of your card a breeze. It even comes with MuseTree, which is an AI-powered image-generation app that gives the creative inside you a boost by letting you create images, manage ideas, and unlock new inspirations as you go.

You can now grab the graphics card for just $570, after an impressive $140 discount on its retail price of $710. This makes the upgrade much more affordable, but only for a short time. Don’t miss out on the chance to grab it for less, as this is one of the lowest prices we have seen the card drop to.

item.title: Meta Ray-Ban (Gen 1) Just Fell Even Lower Than Black Friday, the Smart AI Glasses Are Now Priced Like No-Name Sunglasses
item.content:encoded:
Black Friday  and Cyber Monday have become synonymous with big savings, making it the perfect moment to check off gift lists for friends, family, and everyone in between. But, of what’s this? We missed it. Black Friday and Cyber Monday have already come to pass. In that case, someone should tell Ray-Ban because on Amazon you can find that the price of the Ray-Ban Meta Smart Glasses is still discounted by a generous 25%. Normally sold for $299, the glasses can now be picked up for just $224—a solid opportunity for anyone looking to for some fancy new gadget or a unique gift for a loved one.

See at Amazon

A Blend of Technology and Iconic Style

These first-gen Ray-Ban Meta Smart Glasses come with Meta AI technology baked into Ray-Ban’s signature look. Outfitted with an HD ultra-wide 12-megapixel camera and a five-microphone array, these glasses allow you to capture life’s moments with impressive clarity—hands-free and on demand. Whether you want to snap a quick photo, record a video, or simply ask a question about something in view, the glasses can help through intuitive voice commands. Meta AI can even help you store information for later, and tasks such as scanning a QR code can be done simply by looking at one.

Beyond visual capture, the glasses offer a robust audio experience thanks to built-in open-ear speakers. These connect effortlessly to Spotify, allowing you to enjoy your favorite playlists or podcasts while keeping your ears open to the world around you. Phone calls are equally convenient. The audio system delivering clear, natural sound. During video calls, you can switch between your phone’s front camera and the glasses’ perspective simply by double-tapping the frame, offering callers a real-time glimpse of what you’re seeing. Voice commands extend further, enabling you to place calls, send texts, or deliver voice messages through apps like WhatsApp and Facebook Messenger without ever pulling out your phone.

The Meta AI Ray-Ban glasses now even support real-time translations. You can maintain a full conversation across languages without knowing a single word outside your native tongue. It supports French, Italian, Spanish, English, German, and Portuguese, with more languages coming on the horizons. And it can do all this locally, without needing to be connected to Wi-Fi.

Battery life is another strong point. The Ray-Ban Meta Smart Glasses offer up to four hours of usage per charge, and the included charging case boosts total battery life to an impressive 36 hours. After connecting the glasses to your smartphone, the Meta View app serves as a central hub where you can access the photos and videos you’ve taken, tweak custom voice controls, and manage other key settings.

With multiple color options and a choice between clear or tinted lenses, the Ray-Ban Meta Smart Glasses cater to a variety of styles. And with Amazon’s current 25% discount—knocking a full $75 off the regular price—they’re more accessible than ever. At just $224, they make for an exciting, forward-thinking gift option this holiday season.

item.title: Metroid Prime 4 Makes You Drive Around The Desert In Silence Unless You Buy This $30 Amiibo
item.content:encoded:
God, Nintendo can be an annoying company. Not 24 hours ago, I was writing about how it made Mario Kart World’s music volume options a toggle that only let you choose between “normal” and “louder,” and now Metroid Prime 4: Beyond is out today and has its own obnoxious music options for players to contend with. At least Mario Kart World’s nonsense came at no additional cost to you. Metroid has paywalled basic options and features behind $30 amiibo figures.

One of the big additions to Metroid Prime 4 is an open-world hub space that Samus travels through on a super cool motorcycle. Unfortunately, this area is pretty lifeless, and you only really have the rattle and hum of Samus’ bike to accompany its desolate, isolating vibes. 

There’s some ambient music in the background, but it’s certainly not doing much to make these sections exciting. Some open-world games, like Grand Theft Auto or Cyberpunk 2077, let you turn on a radio station while traveling to make driving segments more stimulating, but Metroid Prime 4 has no such option…unless you buy the Metroid Prime 4 Samus amiibo.

Let me get this straight: If you pay $29.99 for the collectible Samus amiibo in #MetroidPrime4 you get to play/select music while driving the Vi-O-La bike in the otherwise quiet desert… In other words: They locked MUSIC while riding through a desert behind a $30 paywall… Am… https://t.co/qmFRbvdNhR

— Luke Stephens (@LukeStephens) December 3, 2025

The figure allows you to change the music while riding your motorcycle, and paywalling such a basic feature would be maddening if it weren’t also one of the most Nintendo-ass decisions the company could have made. I think I’m more impressed by the new ways it finds to be obtuse than anything. 

Amiibo figures, small figurines of characters that unlock things when you tap them on a Nintendo game system were first introduced in 2014 for the Wii U and 3DS, and have always come with bonus in-game rewards that were, often items or cosmetics. Gating features that would be standard in most games is so weirdly hostile that I’m surprised Nintendo gets away with it.

For whatever it’s worth, the Samus amiibo looks great, but do keep in mind it’s not to be confused with the other Samus figure that includes her bike. That one won’t let you change the music; instead, it will let you change the motorcycle’s color and see how much you’ve traveled on your chopper. Good thing these things look pretty on a shelf. I’m trying to imagine what would happen if any other company charged $30 for baseline functionality. It probably wouldn’t go well!

item.title: JBL Makes a No-Margin Play With Its Flip 7 Speaker to Offload Leftover Black Friday Stock
item.content:encoded:
As we soar right toward the end of the year, all our Instagram and Twitter feeds are now expectedly inundated with Spotify Wrapped. The music streaming platform’s end-of-year personal summaries always make for a fun time of defending you’re quirky top 5s or lying that, “I only really use Spotify when my kids are in the car. I definitely didn’t listen to 5,247 minutes of ‘This Is What It Sounds Like’ from K-Pop Demon Hunters on my own!” It’s okay. Me too, buddy.

Part of Spotify Wrapped is the platform automatically makes a playlist for you of your top listened-to songs of the year. So why not give your faves, your absolute bangers, your cream of the crop the justice they deserve by blasting your songs over a brand new JBL Flip 7 Bluetooth speaker? Amazon actually has the portable speaker on sale at the moment for 27% off. The JBL speaker normally goes for $150, but the discount takes $40 off the top, leaving you only having to pay an easy $110 for a limited time.

See at Amazon

Louder, Clearer, and With More Powerful Sound

The JBL Flip 7 features a two-way speaker system that delivers stunning sound with impressive bass. The woofer handles deep lows and midrange frequencies, while the tweeter produces crisp, high-end notes—combining for a rich, dynamic audio experience that you can both hear and feel. The long-lasting battery provides up to 16 hours of playback on a single charge, so you’ll have plenty of time to enjoy your music, all day or nearly all of it.

Take your music anywhere with the portable JBL Flip 7. It’s designed for on-the-go use, including both a loop and carabiner. The speaker has an IP67 rating for waterproof and dustproof protection. So it doesn’t matter whether you’re by the pool or at the beach, you can enjoy your tunes in almost any environment. Its durable fabric and rubber exterior are built to withstand rough conditions and minor impacts.

The JBL Flip 7 comes in a variety of colors to suit your personality. Choose from vibrant shades like red, blue, green, pink, or opt for the camo version. Just be careful not to set it down in the grass. If you prefer a more subtle look, there are also sleek sand, white, and black options available.

Like other recent JBL Bluetooth models, the Flip 7 supports PartyBoost, allowing you to pair it with other compatible speakers to create stereo or surround sound. This is perfect for parties or events where you want to fill multiple rooms with music.

Right now, Amazon is offering the JBL Flip 7 at a 27% discount, saving you $40 and bringing the price down to just $110 for a limited time. Listen to Huntrix and the Saja Boys the way they were meant to be heard.
